ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:1.2_0: the nun Caṇḍakāḷī then went to the Sangha of nuns and asked them for the full admission.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:1.6_0: At that time the Sangha of nuns gave full admission to other nuns who had been fully ordained.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:1.8_0: “So it seems I’m ignorant and shameless,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:1.9_0: The Sangha gives full admission to other nuns, but only if she does not give her the full admission.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:1.10_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:1.12_0: decided that she would get up.” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:1.13_0: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Caṇḍakāḷī did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:1.18_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:1.19_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:1.20.1_0: ‘If a nun is told, “Venerable, you have given enough full admissions for now,” and she consents, saying, “Fine,” but then criticizes it afterwards, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:2.1.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:2.1.5_0: Venerable, you’ve got up before you.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:2.1.6_0: Venerable, you have given enough full ordinations for now.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:2.1.7_0: If she consents to him, but then criticizes it afterwards, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:2.2.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:2.2.2_0: if she criticizes one who regularly acts from desire, ill will, confusion, or fear;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:2.2.4_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc76:2.2.5_0: The sixth training rule is finished.
